Comments_List: Skills of presentation and public speaking.
How to deliver a scientific presentation.

I was able to better develop presentation skills which will help me during my scientific career (make slides that are visually appealing, modulate voice tone, provide a context and logic to a scientific story and make use of animations and schematics to better explain a piece of data).

In addition, this course helped me to be able to critically analyze relevant papers in my field as well as understand and have a general background of papers in other areas of biology and science.
Working together with another student and a faculty member to understand the past, present, and future of a given research question.
It would be great if we could focus more on the science part and discuss about the papers in more detail.
Good environment for feedback, good practice.

This class is extremely useful and I would highly recommended. Previously, it was suggested that it would be a great idea to invite some of the first or senior authors of the papers presented as way to get a better sense of the thinking behind a given experiment or the knowledge of the field at that time.

In addition, I see a potential if students are allowed to choose the person who are going to be reading with (e.g. a member of their qualifying committee) . For example, most students are qualifying during the development of the course and reading relevant papers in their respective areas. Thus, it would be good idea to allow the students to present a paper that they have read with one of the evaluating committee as it will give an opportunity for the students to consolidate the knowledge acquired during the reading period and also being able to explain that to their peers.

Lots of helpful "pressure" to improve and give good presentations -- both from other students and from course staff. Some of the papers that were chosen to be presented didn't feel very "classic", but a minor issue.
Yes - it's a great way to get better at presentations.

Yes, the course has allowed me to explore other fields within the realm of biology that I might have not read about if it was not for this class. Also, it helped me to improve my presentation skills. Also, Dr. Greco is truly an excellent and amazing mentor.
Even if it wasn't required, I would recommend it because presentation skills are essential for anyone.
